flawed_nl_solution:
The classes in the pack cost $75.0 each because 75 / 10 = <<75/10=75.0>>75.0
An additional class costs $100.0 because 75.0 x (1 +(1/3)) = <<75.0*(1+(1/3))=100.0>>100.0
She buys 3 extra classes because 13 - 10 = <<13-10=3>>3
Her three additional classes cost $300.0 because 3 x 100.0 = <<3*100.0=300.0>>300.0
Her total cost is $375.0 because 75 + 300.0 = <<75+300.0=375.0>>375.0

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 7.5, not 75.0. It appears the decimal point was misplaced.
